areal1.title: Park Babelsberg
areal1.description: The 124-hectare English landscape park on the banks of the Havel is a masterpiece of garden art. UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1990.

areal2.title: Babelsberg Palace
areal2.description: The neo-Gothic summer palace of Emperor Wilhelm I majestically overlooks the Havel. Built 1833-1849 to designs by Karl Friedrich Schinkel.

areal3.title: New Garden
areal3.description: An early masterpiece of landscape design on the Heiliger See. Created from 1787 for Friedrich Wilhelm II. The Potsdam Conference took place here in 1945.

areal4.title: Park Glienicke
areal4.description: The southernmost part of the UNESCO World Heritage landscape at the Glienicke Bridge. A hidden gem with Italian-inspired architecture.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to the most important questions about your visit.

q1.question: Where can I find toilets in the park?
q1.answer: Public toilets are signposted at the main entrances. Use our Location Finder to find the nearest toilet. Some require a fee (approx. €0.50), others are free.

q2.question: Is the park accessible?
q2.answer: The paved main paths are easily accessible for wheelchairs and strollers. Some nature trails have inclines and are less suitable. The Flatow Tower is not accessible (only accessible via stairs).

q3.question: Can I grill or picnic in the park?
q3.answer: Picnicking is allowed on the lawns. Grilling is prohibited throughout the park (fire safety). Please take your trash with you or dispose of it in the provided bins.

q4.question: Can I cycle through the park?
q4.answer: Cycling is only allowed on paved main paths. Cycling is prohibited on hiking trails and nature paths. Follow signs on site. More details in our park regulations.

q5.question: Are dogs allowed in the park?
q5.answer: Yes, dogs are allowed but must be kept on a leash. Please bring dog waste bags and dispose of them in the bins.

q6.question: Can I swim in the Havel?
q6.answer: No, swimming in the Havel is prohibited (no lifeguard, current, boat traffic). Alternative swimming spots are available at Heiliger See in the New Garden.

q7.question: Are there guided tours of the park?
q7.answer: Yes, the Prussian Palaces and Gardens Foundation offers regular tours. Dates and booking at www.spsg.de.

q8.question: How long should I plan for a visit?
q8.answer: For a relaxed walk: 2-3 hours. With palace tour and Flatow Tower: 4-5 hours. For all 4 areas: full day trip recommended.
